Breaking Bear is an upcoming adult animated comedy television series created by Julien Nitzberg for Fox's ad-supported streaming service Tubi as the second animated original series on the platform after The Freak Brothers.
It is co-produced by Evoke Entertainment, To the Stars Media and 9 Story Media Group, the latter marks the second adult-oriented project by 9 Story Media Group, the first being Fugget About It. Nitzberg serves as an executive producer and showrunner, along with Tom DeLonge, Jeff Holland, Stan Spry, Eric Scott Woods and Bradford Bricken.
Breaking Bear will consist of eight episodes. The running time of the series will be 22 minutes long.
Plot
Breaking Bear takes place in a world where animals and humans live together, and follows the adventures of the family of bears as they go on a full criminal with the mobsters and the Wolf pack.
Cast
* Brendan Fraser as Jer, the oldest of the bear siblings.
* Sarah Michelle Gellar as Blair, the middle child of the bear siblings.
* Josh Gad as Alistar, the youngest of the bear siblings.
* Elizabeth Hurley as Wolf Queen, the fierce and unyielding guardian of the forest.
* Annie Murphy as Tawny, a human.
Production
Development
After the success of the first animated original series The Freak Brothers, on August 15, 2022, it was announced that Tubi had greenlit another adult animated series, this time is titled Breaking Bear. The series is created by Julien Nitzberg, who previously served as a director on the documentary, The Wild and Wonderful Whites of West Virginia and acting as a writer and consulting producer on the Cinemax animated original series Mike Judge Presents: Tales from the Tour Bus. Nitzberg serves as an executive producer and showrunner with Tom DeLonge, Jeff Holland, Stan Spry, Eric Scott Woods and Bradford Bricken, who are the executive producers of the show.  Currently in pre-production, the series comes from Evoke Entertainment (formerly known as Cartel Entertainment) and To the Stars Media. The series is a parody of various mobster dramas, and it is described as Yogi Bear meets The Sopranos with a mix of adult animation, and three bears selling drugs.
In February 2024, 9 Story Media Group announced that it will take over production on the series. In May 2025, Brendan Fraser, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Josh Gad, Elizabeth Hurley, and Annie Murphy joined the cast.
